17.m: But to all who did receive him, who believed in his name, he gave the right to become children of God, who were born, not of blood nor of the will of the flesh nor of the will of man, but of God. - John 1:12-13 (ESV)

l.q: Who was with God in the beginning?
l.a: The Word was in the beginning with God. The Word was God. All things were made through him. He has life, which is the light of men. He is coming into the world.
Jesus Christ is the Word. Jesus Christ already existed before he was even born on earth. Jesus Christ existed long before the first Christmas day.

l.q: What happens to those who receive and believe in Christ?
l.a: To all who received Jesus Christ and believed in his name, he gave the right to become children of God.

l.q: What does this verse mean - 'For the law was given through Moses; grace and truth came through Jesus Christ'?
l.a: Prior to the coming of Christ on earth, people were bound by the laws given to them by God through Moses. They have to make offerings as atonement for their sins and guilt. But Christ came on earth and fulfilled the law. He is God's grace to us. He died for our sins so we can be made right with God.

s.h:
Pleased as man with men to dwell 
 Jesus, our Emmanuel

17.a: Enjoy a cup of warm chocolate or apple cider with someone who lives with you.
